intro: Linaria sabulicola, commonly known as the sand linaria, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants. This annual plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and narrow, linear leaves, adapted to conserve water in its harsh habitat.
